title.narrative: Ancestral Peoples of the Mangrove Ecosystem of Ecuador Recover the Territories where they Live and Produce

description.narrative: This project will be jointly implemented by two organizations—FUNDECOL and C-CONDE—along with Heifer in five provinces on Ecuador’s coast, where seventy percent of the mangrove ecosystem, which provides the livelihood of small fishing and gathering peoples, has been illegally destroyed to farm tropical shrimp. This practice has displaced people from their ancestral territory and caused the loss of their incomes. This project will support 623 families and another 1,513 families through Passing on the Gift and in capacity building to sustainably reforest the mangrove. Participants will also pursue legal arbitration so communities can exercise their constitutional rights in the territories illegally occupied. Three alternatives for income generation will be combined with national and local advocacy: community tourism microenterprise will increase the number of visitors and improve operation; agroecological and mangrove ecosystem fairs will improve their operations; and local consumers who know about the mangrove ecosystem’s problems will engage in marketing to conserve the mangrove ecosystem.
